intro: Perymenium buphthalmoides var. flexuosum, commonly known as the flexible eye-bulb plant, is a rare and specialized species native to specific regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and typically herbaceous growth habit. The plant features elongated, flexible stems that can bend and twist, allowing it to adapt to windy or disturbed environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss in arid conditions. The flowers are small and clustered, often displaying a range of colors from yellow to reddish-brown, contributing to its ornamental value in botanical collections.
